auth.configuration-2: Check the server logs for more information.
auth.input-valid-email: Please enter a valid email address
auth.sign-in-link: A sign in link has been sent to your email address.

auth.verification-1: The sign in link is no longer valid.
auth.verification-2: It may have been used already or it may have expired.

chat.clear-current-conversation: Are you sure to clear the current conversation?
chat.type-message-commandEnter: Type message here... (send with Command + Enter, can be modified in Settings)
chat.type-message-ctrlEnter: Type message here... (send with Ctrl + Enter, can be modified in Settings)
chat.type-message-enter: Type message here... (send with Enter, can be modified in Settings)

common.service-error: Service is having a hiccup, please try again later

menu.clear-conversation: Are you sure clear all conversations?
menu.delete-conversation: Are you sure delete this conversation?

prompt.get-title: What would be a short and relevant title for this chat? You must strictly answer with only the title, no other text is allowed.

responseErr.10001: Please log in or configure your API Key.
responseErr.10002: API Key missing, please check configuration or contact the developer
responseErr.10004: Please configure Azure API Version first

setting.api-key-error: Invalid API key. Please make sure your API key is still working properly.
setting.check-api-key-warning: You need to fill in the API Key first to check its validity.
setting.max-tokens-tip: Set token limits for each model response. These tokens are shared between prompts (including system messages, examples, message history, and user queries) and model responses. One token is roughly equivalent to 4 characters of typical English text.
setting.name: Name
setting.reset-data-tip: Are you sure you want to reset all data? (Including chat and settings data)
setting.sure-delete-deployment: Are you sure you want to delete this deployment?
setting.temperature-tip: Higher values will make the output more random, while lower values will make the output more focused and more deterministic.
setting.title: L-GPT Setting

token.how-token-work-1: It is calculated according to the rules of each language model based on the total length of the current session content.
token.how-token-work-2: When the conversation reaches a certain length, you will no longer be able to add any more messages to the conversation. This is a contextual limit on the conversation content of each language model.
token.how-token-work-3: For example, GPT-3.5 allows a maximum of 4,096 tokens per session. GPT-4 allows a maximum of 8,192 tokens per session in its 8K model, and a maximum of 32,768 tokens in its 32K model. The context length limit may increase for various language models in the future.
token.how-token-work-4: If the current conversation reaches the context limit, you can delete some of the conversation content or start a new conversation to continue chatting.
token.how-to-cost-1: Any content related to a chat conversation will incur conversation costs.
token.how-to-cost-2-1: All costs are "estimated values" calculated by
token.how-to-cost-3: Each language model has its own pricing, and the corresponding official website has a detailed description of the pricing.
token.know-more: Click here to learn more about OpenAI models, tokens, and context limits.
token.token-desc: Tokens areÂ the basic unit thatÂ LLM models use to compute the length of a text. They are groups of characters, which sometimes align with words, but not always. In particular, it depends on the number of characters and includes punctuation signs or emojis.

welcome.apply-azure-key: If you don't have an Azure OpenAI API Key, you can get one here:
welcome.apply-openai-key: If you don't have an OpenAI API Key, you can get one here:
welcome.desc: L-GPT is an open-source project that helps you improve your learning, work, and life efficiency by providing various AI models.
welcome.set-openai-key: Please click on the settings button in the lower left corner to configure your API Key.

zLog.title: v0.4.3 Change Log ðŸ”¥ðŸ”¥
zLog.text1: Fixed the issue where unauthenticated users could not have a normal conversation even after configuring the API key
zLog.text2: Upgrade the default Azure OpenAI Service API version from 2023-03-15-preview to 2023-05-15.
zLog.text3: Refactor the calculation logic for session consumption, now supporting display of current session content consumption and total session consumption.
zLog.text4: Refactor the API Key configuration interface and move it to a separate page for configuration. It is now possible to configure Azure OpenAI Service-related information in a more user-friendly way.
zLog.text5: Other details optimization and bug fixing
